newsitem.title: USA: 3M reports record profits for quarter, stock jumps.
newsitem.headline: 3M reports record profits for quarter, stock jumps.

text.p: Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co. Tuesday reported record operating profits for the fourth quarter and the full year, despite currency fluctuations that cut into its results.

The St. Paul, Minn.-based company, whose business interests range from speciality chemicals to medical supplies, said it earned $375 million, or 90 cents a share, on sales of $3.62 billion in the latest quarter vs. year-earlier profits of $266 million, or 63 cents, a share on sales of $3.30 billion. The year-ago results exclude a one-time, pre-tax restructuring charge of $79 million, or 12 cents a share.
The company, which generates more than half of its sales abroad, said currency fluctuations trimmed its earnings for the quarter by about 4 cents a share.
Following the news, 3M's stock rose $2.875 to $84.875 on the New York Stock Exchange.

"The strong momentum in 3M's financial performance continues," said 3M Chairman L.D. DeSimone. "Double-digit volume growth in the United States and abroad and healthy productivity gains drove our record fourth-quarter results."
DeSimone said, "We expect solid sales and earnings growth again in 1997."
The company said that in the United States, it had solid growth, with strong gains posted in speciality chemicals, electronic connectors, medical supplies and pharmaceuticals.
Internationally, 3M reported double-digit volume gains in all major geographic areas.
